subject: RBA Governor Lowe says legitimate to question how effective monetary easing would be globally and that if everyone is easing, the impact on exchange rates is offset
content:
Says:

  • More infrastructure investment would benefit the Australian economy and that government can borrow at historic lows but must be projects that can make a return.
  • Other Twitter sources report that Lowe suggested it is unclear what further impact easing could have on the economy.

subject: RBA Governor Lowe says risks to global economy are tilted to the downside
Israel Defense Forces reportedly increased its alert status amid concerns Iran could attempt to harm Israel amid US-Iran tensions
ACCC says there are concerns related to AP Eagers (APE AT) proposed acquisition of Automotive Holdings (AHG AT)
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Ausdrill (ASL AT) unit Barminco secured a contract valued at AUD 800mln
content:
AUSTRALIA

ANZ Bank (ANZ AT) - Co. said it will work with the RBNZ on an independent review of its capital models amid RBNZ request for 2 reports from ANZ New Zealand to provide assurance it is operating in a prudent manner, while there were also comments from RBNZ Governor Orr that ANZ remains sound and well capitalized. (Newswires)

Ausdrill (ASL AT) - Co. unit Barminco secured a contract valued at AUD 800mln. (Newswires)

Aveo Group (AOG AT) - Co. received a confidential non-binding and conditional indicative proposal, while it suggested that its results are to be adversely impacted. (Newswires)

Donaco International (DNA AT) - Co. Expects a statutory less in FY19 and said no dividends or buybacks will be permitted in FY20. (Newswires)

GrainCorp (GNX AT) - Co. will begin the search for successor to CEO Palmquist and has named Graham Bradley as Malt unit Chairman if the demerger occurs. (Newswires)

Kogan.com (KGN AT) - Co. inks multi-year partnership agreement with Powershop Australia in which it will offer power and gas services to households under a new brand Kogan Energy. (Newswires)

Metcash (MTS AT) - Co. FY19 underlying net fell 3% Y/Y to AUD 210.3mln, rev. rose 1.4% Y/Y to AUD 14.6bln, declares FY19 final dividend of AUD 0.07/Shr. (Newswires)

Murray Goulburn (MGC AT) - Co. announced AUD 42mln settlement related to Endeavor River class action. (Newswires)

Paladin Energy (PDN AT) - Co. will sell 85% stake in Kayelekera to JV led by Hylea. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

Mitsubishi Motors (7211 JT) - Co. will offload its 15% stake in Harbin Dongan Auto Engine Co. as soon as the current fiscal year-end. (Nikkei)

Nissan (7201 JT) - Co. shareholders will vote on plans to make significant board changes tomorrow. (Newswires)

SoftBank (9984 JT) - Co. CEO said they will IPO ARM Holdings within 2 years. (Nikkei)

Sumitomo Rubber Industries (5110 JT) - Co. is to increase domestic tire prices by an average 3% beginning in August. (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Trade - Some major South Korean companies are said to be shifting production out of China. (Newswires)

Other News - South Korea's finance ministry is expected to slightly downgrade its 2019 growth estimate from the current forecast of 2.5%-2.6%. (Yonhap)

subject: Over 400 pilots joined a class-action suit against Boeing (BA) alleging that it conducted an unprecedented mass cover up related to the 737 MAX plane
Update: Air France (AF FP) flight has landed safely after returning shortly after takeoff due to losing an engine
Air France (AF FP) flight AF681 from Atlanta to Paris declares an emergency due to left engine and appears to be returning shortly after take off, according to Twitter reports
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights New Zealand Credit Card Spending, Japanese Leading Index, Singapore CPI and RBA Governor Lowe Speech

ANZ Bank (ANZ AT) says it will work with the RBNZ on an independent review of its capital models amid RBNZ request for 2 reports from ANZ New Zealand to provide assurance it is operating in a prudent manner
content: • RBNZ Governor Orr says ANZ remains sound and well capitalized.

subject: DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US Commerce Department added 5 Chinese entities to its entities list barring them from buying US parts without government approval, while there were source reports the US is considering requiring 5G equipment for domestic use be made outside China. (Newswires)

US VP Pence is to indefinitely postpone his China policy address and said there are positive signs of progress in talks with China. (Newswires)

China Global Times Editor said China is concerned about fairness of the trade deal and the most important part is the US side must remove all newly imposed tariffs since the trade war or else China won't accept a deal. (Twitter)

 

UK/EU

UK Conservative Party is reportedly making plans that would permit the next PM to hold off from putting their Brexit plans to Parliament until Autumn which could limit the time to reach a deal to just over 3 weeks before the October 31st deadline. (Independent)

ECB's Draghi told EU leaders that signs of weakness are increasing and that the economic rebound is weaker than expected, while he also suggested that in the absence of a sustained return to the ECB's inflation target, additional stimulus will be required. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Spain at A-; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

 

FX

Turkey opposition candidate Imamoglu beat former PM and Erdogan ally Yildirim in the rerun of the Istanbul mayoral election. (Newswires)

Canadian Retail Sales (Apr) M/M 0.1% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. 1.1%, Rev. 1.3%). (Newswires) 

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes (June 21): oil rigs +1 at 789, gas rigs -4 at 177, total US rigs -2 at 967. (Newswires)

India's Oil Minister spoke to Saudi Energy Minister Al-Falih and expressed concern on rising prices after the tanker attacks in the Strait of Hormuz and wants Saudi Arabia to play an active role in OPEC+ to keep oil prices at a reasonable level. (Newswires)

 

GEOPOLITICS

US President Trump suggested on Friday that nothing was ever greenlit on Iran retaliation and that a military strike which would have killed 150 people would not have been proportionate to Iran shooting down an unmanned drone, while he also commented that he is in no hurry but the US military is ready to go. In related news, VOX reported on Friday that 2 US officials and a source familiar with deliberations suggested there were still plans for the US to strike Iran on Friday night although it was also possible that the plan would not be put into action. (Twitter/NBC/VOX/EHA News)

US President Trump said he has no pre-conditions for talks with Iran and that he would be willing to meet with the Ayatollah or President but added that ballistic missiles would have to be considered in a deal. However, US President Trump also said that they are moving ahead with additional sanctions on Iran aimed at preventing it from getting a nuclear weapon and that military action is still on the table, while other reports also noted the White House is pressing for additional options including in cyberspace and other additional clandestine plans to counter Iranian aggression in the Persian Gulf. (Newswires/NYTimes)

US President Trump administration’s Middle East peace plan reportedly proposes USD 50bln investment in Palestinian territories, Egypt, Jordan and Lebanon. In related news, US President Trump spoke with the Saudi Crown Prince bin Salman on Middle East stability as well as the oil market. (Newswires)

Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman said Iran responds to diplomacy with diplomacy and war with firm defence, while an Iranian President advisor commented that if US President Trump doesn't want war with Iran, he has to ease sanctions. (Newswires)

Iran said it believes EU lacks the will to salvage the multinational 2015 nuclear deal, while its Deputy Foreign Minister said the decision to decrease its commitment to nuclear deal is a national decision and irreversible as long as its demands are not met. (Newswires)

 

US

Fed's Brainard (voter, dove) said risk management argues for a lower rate path when risks shift to the downside and that she has seen downside risks in recent weeks. Brainard also said that inflation indicators have been disappointing making it important to sustain momentum, while she added that US economy remains solid and that rates will likely remain low in the future. (Newswires)

Fed's Clarida (voter, neutral) said there is broad agreement that the case for looser policy has increased and that they will act appropriately to sustain the expansion, while Clarida added trends overseas might affect the US outlook and the Fed has the flexibility to act as needed as rates are not close to the zero bound. (Newswires)

Fed's Kashkari (non-voter, dove) said he called for a 50bps rate cut at last week's meeting and argued that aggressive action is needed to reanchor inflation. Kashkari also noted that he sees long-run inflation expectations around 1.7% and suggested the Fed should commit to not raising rates until inflation is sustainably at 2.0%. (Newswires)

Fed stress test results on Friday showed all banks exceeded minimum capital requirements and at strong levels that would allow them to remain above minimum required level after being tested against a severe hypothetical recession scenario. (Newswires)

Outgoing CEA Chair Hassett said the market is now expecting what US President Trump has been expecting for months; that global economy is much softer than what we thought 8-9 months ago. (Newswires)

  • US Markit Manufacturing PMI (Jun F) 50.1 vs. Exp. 50.4 (Prev. 50.5); lowest since 2009. (Newswires)
  • US Markit Services PMI (Jun F) 50.7 vs. Exp. 51.0 (Prev. 50.9)
  • US Markit Composite (Jun F) 50.6 (Prev. 50.9)
  • US Existing Home Sales (May) 5.34M vs. Exp. 5.25M (Prev. 5.19M, Rev. 5.21M)

 

MARKET RECAP

CarMax (KMX) jumped higher after posting earnings that beat analyst expectations on both the top and bottom line. Laboratory Corp of America Holdings (LH) was upgraded at Deutsche Bank, which cited attractive valuations. PG&E (PCG) is mulling restructuring plan, which offered two-way volatility. Caterpillar (CAT) was under pressure, after a downgrade at Atlantic Equities, which is concerned about the global demand outlook. Apple (AAPL) was under pressure amid the iPhone maker recalling some of its MacBook Pro laptops in China. Micron Technologies (MU) fell after a number of brokers reduced their PTs for the chipmaker, citing concerns over the Huawei ban. Canopy Growth Corp (CGC) sunk after reporting bigger losses than expected, dragging stakeholder Constellation Brands (STZ) with it. PayPal (PYPL) fell after its COO resigned. Carnival Corp (CCL) fell, with Barclays downgrading the stock to underweight. The FTC has issued an objection to Qualcomm’s (QCOM) legal push to introduce internal Apple documents as evidence against the enforcement of the antitrust ruling made against the chipmaker in May. Tesla (TSLA) was also under pressure after a source suggested that Q2 optimism on deliveries may be overdone. Energy names performed well as crude prices remained elevated, as did gold names as Gold reclaimed the USD 1400 handle. S&P 500 -0.1% at 2951, NASDAQ-100 -0.1% at 7729, Dow Jones -0.1% at 26720.

Treasuries gave back some of the geopolitically induced gains seen on Thursday, with yields settling 5-7bps higher across the curve; this added some daylight between the 10-year yield and the 2% handle (which was breached on Thursday for the first time since Nov’2016). However, geopolitical analysts have warned that the tensions are far from over, and even though Trump has reached out to Iranian leaders for unconditional talks, military options remain. One macro desk noted that the 10-year yield is set to close higher for the seventh consecutive week, a rare event which last occurred in July 2016 (then finished sharply lower the next week, coinciding with Brexit events). Most of the run of today’s Fedspeak was an echo of the dovishness seen at the FOMC this week; the probability of a July rate cut has edged up to around 70% on Friday (from 60% a week ago), and money markets are pricing just shy of three rate cuts by the end of the year (CFTC data showed speculators adding long positions ahead of the Fed meeting). Next week’s sales of 2s, 5s and 7s will be eyed, with desks suggesting that the dovish Fed pricing could support the complex, like we saw in the 3s/10s/30s auctions recently, especially so amid the geopolitical background. US T-notes (U9) settled 17+ lower at 127-16+.

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
